newsitem.title: TURKEY: Death toll in Turkey munitions blast rises to two.
newsitem.headline: Death toll in Turkey munitions blast rises to two.

text.p: The death toll from a series of huge explosions at a munitions factory in central Turkey rose to two when a worker at the plant died in hospital, Anatolian news agency said on Friday.
Thousands of residents of the town of Kirikkale spent the night outdoors in fear that blasts from the nearby factory would engulf their homes, the agency said.
Blasts that sent flames 1,000 feet (300 metres) into the sky shook the town all day on Thursday, damaging houses and destroying the factory.
The south of the town was evacuated after the first explosion. Kirikkale is home to around 100,000 people.
Dozens of people, including police and soldiers, were cut by flying debris and were treated in makeshift field clinics. The town's hospital was evacuated.
The Interior Ministry estimated the damage to be at least one trillion Turkish lira ($6.7 million).
